abstract: Federal Judge Royce C Lamberth sentences Nicholas A Slatten to life in prison and Paul A Slough, Dustin L Heard and Evan S Liberty to 30-year sentences for 2007 killing of 14 unarmed Iraqis in Baghdad's Nisour Square; Jeremy P Ridgeway, who pleads guilty, is not sentenced; men, former employees of Blackwater, deny any wrongdoing; ruling ends long inquiry into shooting, which has been called wartime atrocity and put spotlight on United States' use of private security contractors during war.
lead_paragraph: One member of the private American security firm received a life term and three others 30 years after they were convicted of killing 14 unarmed Iraqis in Baghdad’s Nisour Square in 2007.

headline.main: Ex-Blackwater Guards Given Long Terms for Killing Iraqis
headline.print_headline: Blackwater Crew Given Long Terms for Killing Iraqis

snippet: One member of the private American security firm received a life term and three others 30 years after they were convicted of killing 14 unarmed Iraqis in Baghdad’s Nisour Square in 2007.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
